verses.verse: There was a man <S%H376><s%> in the land <S%H776><s%> of Uz, <S%H5780><s%> whose name <S%H8034><s%> was Job. <S%H347><s%> That man <S%H376><s%> was blameless and upright, <S%H3477><s%> and one <S%H376><s%> who feared <S%H3373><s%> God, <S%H430><s%> and turned <S%H5493><s%> away from evil. <S%H7451><s%>

Then Satan <S%H7854><s%> answered <S%H6030><s%> Yahweh, <S%H3068><s%> and said, <S%H559><s%> "Does Job <S%H347><s%> fear <S%H3372><s%> God <S%H430><s%> for nothing? <S%H2600><s%>

that there came <S%H935><s%> a messenger <S%H4397><s%> to Job, <S%H347><s%> and said, <S%H559><s%> "The oxen <S%H1241><s%> were plowing, <S%H2790><s%> and the donkeys <S%H860><s%> feeding <S%H7462><s%> beside them, <S%H3027><s%>

While he was still speaking, <S%H1696><s%> there came <S%H935><s%> also another, <S%H559><s%> and said, "The Chaldeans <S%H3778><s%> made <S%H7760><s%> three <S%H7969><s%> bands, <S%H7218><s%> and swept <S%H6584><s%> down on the camels, <S%H1581><s%> and have taken them away, <S%H3947><s%> yes, <S%H5221><s%> and killed the servants <S%H5288><s%> with the edge <S%H6310><s%> of the sword; <S%H2719><s%> and I alone have escaped <S%H4422><s%> to tell you. <S%H5046><s%>"
